oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A COMPREHENSIVE HYDRODYNAMIC ANALYSIS OF WATER WAVES INTERACTION WITH SUBMERGED BREAKWATERS: NUMERICAL AND EXPERIMENTAL STUDY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Belkacem, Yasmine Ben
Tournant, Paul
Perret, Gaële
Lebunetel, Julie
Pinon, Grégory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The present work describes the numerical investigation with experimental comparisons of water waves interaction with porous structures. The main objective of this work is to assess the ability of the Volume-Averaged Reynolds Averaged Navier-Stokes- based module within the accurately model and simulate the OpenFOAM numerical toolbox to most relevant hydrodynamic processes involved in the interaction between waves and low-crested breakwaters. The numerical approach is further validated against measurements obtained tests conducted for a wide range of wave from the small-scale laboratory conditions at LOMC’s wave channel (University of Le Havre, France).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; structures.44
